misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that identical, repeated computational logic (like the distance formula) should be inlined directly into the main sequence of code, even when instructed to reuse a function/program built previously (Q3). This suggests they view code reuse primarily as copy-pasting rather than utilizing abstract methods.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The conceptual gap is the failure to recognize the value and execution mechanics of procedural abstraction (methods/functions) for code modularity and reusability. In the Java notional machine, methods provide a structured way to execute a common block of code multiple times by passing arguments, which the student bypassed by repeating the calculation steps three times.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: Violation of Problem Instructions (Code includes excessive duplication and ignores the requirement to reuse the Q3 program structure).
